details.title: WATCH | What's at stake this election for Madhya Pradesh
Counting to begin at 8
details.content:
Counting of the ballots will begin exactly at 8 at the strong rooms spread across the state. 

Stay tuned as we bring in all the live updates from the hindi heartland.

details.title: This time the Congress has withheld the Chief Ministerial candidate's name, find out why
details.content:
The Saffron party has declared the present Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan as its CM candidate, Congress hasn’t declared anyone yet.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: Will Shivraj Singh Chouhan retain his chair for the fourth consecutive term?
details.content:
Although exit polls indicated a photo finish in Madhya Pradesh, it gave a slight edge to BJP this election.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: Counting has begun for all 230 seats
details.content: The first round of counting for all 230 seats is currently underway.

details.title: Congress supporters pray outside Rahul Gandhi's residence
details.content:
Congress workers perform 'hawan' outside Rahul Gandhi's residence in Delhi #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/zkuKfW9T2T

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Congress leading in five seats
details.content: Early trends are suggesting that Congress is leading in five seats.

details.title: Shivraj Singh Chouhan hold emergency meeting
details.content: Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan is currently holding an urgent meeting with the party leaders at his residence in Bhopal. BJP national vice president and Rajya Sabha MP Prabhat Jha among those in attendance .

details.title: Congress leading in 12, BJP 11 seats
details.content: Out of the 23 seats, the early trends have suggested that Congress is leading in 12 seats while BJP in 11.

details.title: Only VVPAT chits to be counted for 144 seats
details.content: Due to lapses in not deleting mock poll before start of actual voting at 144 booths in 20 districts on voting day November 28, only VVPAT chits to be counted for those polling booths today.

details.title: Yashodhara Raje Scindia leading from Shivpuri
details.content: Sports minister Yashodhara Raje Scindia from Shivpuri leading after postal ballots counting.

details.title: BJP trailing in Madhya Pradesh
details.content: Current trends suggest Congress leading in 43 seats.

details.title: Congress leading in 60 seats, Digvijay Singh confident of victory
details.content: Digvijay Singh says Rahul Gandhi is Congress face in MP. CM will be decided once we get the numbers. He is confident of Congress forming next govt with comfortable majority.

details.title: BJP cabinet ministers leading
details.content: Six cabinet ministers, jaibhan Singh pavaiya (Gwalior), Yashodhara Raje Scindia (Shivpuri), Rampal Singh (Silwani), Archana Chitnis (Burhanpur), Kunwar Vijay Shah (Harsud), Rajendra Shukla (Rewa) leading.

details.title: Rana Vikram Singh leading from Susner
details.content: Congress rebel Rana Vikram Singh leads from Susner seat of Agar Malwa district.

details.title: Current trends 161/230
details.content:
Congress: 82

BJP: 80

Individual:  1

details.title: BJP takes the lead, claims victory in one seat
details.content: The Bharatiya Janata Party has won one seat in Madhya Pradesh as of now. However, Congres is leading in 98 seats.

details.title: CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan leading from Budhni
Here are the trends from all the five Assembly states:
details.content:
Trends #AssemblyElections2018 #Results2018 #PollsWithAIR:#ChattisgarhElections2018 - Congress leading in 33, BJP-21, JCC(J)-5, BSP-1.। #TelanganaElections2018 : TRS ahead in 55,Congress-32, BJP-4, TDP-2, others-8.#MizoramElections2018 : MNF-16,Congress-13, BJP-2, Independent-1

— All India Radio News (@airnewsalerts) December 11, 2018

details.title: It's a neck to neck fight in Madhya Pradesh
details.content:
Current trends: 213/230

Congress: 104

BJP: 101

Others: 8

details.title: Congress trailing at the moment but it's too close to call
details.content:
Current trends

227/230

BJP - 111

Congress- 109

Others - 7

details.title: PWD minister Rampal Singh trailing from Silwani constituency
details.content: Minister of State for school education Deepak Joshi (son of ex CM Kailash Joshi) trails from Hatpipliya seat of Dewas district, while PWD minister Rampal Singh trails from Silwani seat of Raisen district.

details.title: Celebrations begin for Congress as they take the lead in Rajasthan
details.content:
#Visuals of celebration from outside Congress office in Delhi. #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/4bWIf5EN8I

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Early trends suggest hung Assembly in MP
details.content: Congress and BJP are both with 109 each and Others with 12. If this persists MP could be moving towards hung verdict for the first time

details.title: Bala Bachchan trailing by 5000 votes
details.content: Senior Congress leader and deputy leader of opposition Bala Bachchan trails by 5, 000 votes in pocket borough Rajpur in Barwani district.

details.title: Eight BJP ministers trailing, ruling party loosing grip in Vidisha
details.content:
8 BJP ministers, Jayant Malaiya, Rampal Singh, Deepak Joshi, Rajendra Shukla, Lal Singh Arya, Surendra Patwa, Jaibhan Singh Pavaiya, Narottam Mishra are trailing in Madhya Pradesh. 

BJP trails by 600 votes from Vidisha seat which is considered a saffron bastion.

details.title: Guna MP and Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scinda thanks people of MP for showing their support
details.content:
जनादेश बदलाव का स्पष्ट संकेत दे रहा है।
कांग्रेस के सभी जाँबाज़ साथियों से उम्मीद करता हूँ कि पूरी जिम्मेदारी से जनता की आशाओं पर खरे उतरेंगे।#MadhyaPradeshElections2018 pic.twitter.com/zVgQT8Xvr1

— Jyotiraditya Scindia (@JM_Scindia) December 11, 2018

details.title: PM Narendra Modi chairing emergency core meeting
details.content: Following the trends that are showing a step back for BJP in all three Hindi heartland states, PM Narendra Modi has called for an emergency core meeting.

details.title: Congress inches closer to halfway mark
details.content:
Current trend:

Congress: 111

BJP: 108

BSP: 5

Others: 6 (SP 4).

details.title: Is Congress going to dethrone Shivraj Singh Chouhan?
details.content:
#Results2018 : Going by the trends, #MadhyaPradesh looks like #kamal, as in #KamalNath. is blooming for the #Congress

— santwanabhattacharya (@santwana99) December 11, 2018

details.title: BJP takes the lead
details.content: BJP leading in 111 seats while Congress in 110.

details.title: Congress' Ajay Singh leading from Churhat
details.content: Leader of the Opposition, Ajay Singh is currently leading from Churhat constituency.

details.title: BJP's lone Muslim candidate Fatima Rasool Siddiqui trailing from Bhopal north
details.content: In Bhopal district, BJP's lone Muslim candidate Fatima Rasool Siddiqui is trailing. Congress is leading in Berasiya, Huzur and Madhya, while BJP leads in Govindpura, Dakshin Paschim and Narela.

details.title: Congress workers raise slogans of Lord Ram and Kamal Nath under the same breath
details.content: "Jai Jai Sri Ram" and "Jai Jai Kamal Nath" slogans raised by Congress workers outside party HQ in Bhopal.

details.title: Congress to claim victory in this seesaw battle?
details.content:
Kamal Nath, Congress: These are trends, but I am fully confident that we will get full majority #MadhyaPradeshElections pic.twitter.com/IFoQVSf9E6

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Gloomy faces engulf BJP headquaters
details.content: Atmosphere subdued at BJP state Headquaters. Tense faces amid talks among party workers.

details.title: With a seesaw situation prevailing in Madhya Pradesh, Others to be the kingmaker?
details.content:
Although the Congress touched the halfway mark briefly during the second round of counting, there seems to be a constant seesaw situation prevailing in the state with either of the party failing to take an absolute lead.

With this scenario, will other regional parties like SP and BSP emerge as the kingmaker?

details.title: Congress, BJP both reach out Mayawati for support in the neck-to-neck fight
details.content:
As per TV reports, both Congress and BJP are reaching out to Mayawati's BSP for support speculating a possible hung Assembly. 

Mayawati is likely to support Congress.

details.title: BSP matriarch summons all her party candidate to Delhi
details.content: Mayawati, the possible kingmaker in MP, summoned all her candidates to Delhi.

details.title: Rahul Gandhi reaches 10 Janpath
details.content: Congress President Rahul Gandhi reaches Sonia Gandhi's residence at 10 Janpath.

details.title: As saffron wave seems to fade from Hindi heartland, Mamata Banerjee calls it people's victory
details.content:
People voted against BJP. This is the people’s verdict and victory of the people of this country 1/3

— Mamata Banerjee (@MamataOfficial) December 11, 2018

details.title: BJP leading in 111 seats
details.content: After 10 rounds of counting, BJP is leading in 111 seats.

details.title: BJP MP Sanjay Kakade says defeat was on the cards for the ruling party in Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan
details.content: Knew we would lose in Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh but MP trends have come as a surprise. I think we forgot the issue of development that Modi took up in 2014. Ram Mandir, statues & name changing became the focus :Sanjay Kakade, BJP Rajya Sabha.

details.title: Samajwadi Party extends support to Congress
details.content: The Samajwadi Party, which is leading in one seat, has extended its support to the Congress party in this nail-biting battle.

details.title: 11 BJP ministers currently trailing
details.content: Jaibhan Singh Pavaiya, Vishwas Sarang, Archana Chitnis, Deepak Joshi, Sharad Jain, Lal Singh Arya, Jayant Malaiya and Narottam Mishra, Jaibhan Singh Pavaiya, Vishwas Sarang, Archana Chitnis, Deepak Joshi, Sharad Jain, Lal Singh Arya, Jayant Malaiya and Narottam Mishra, trailing in Madhya Pradesh.

details.title: Congress pushes back to level grounds with BJP, both at 110
details.content: Around 40 seats could go down the wire as the difference there is between 100-1000 votes.
Around 40 seats could go down the wire as the difference there is between 100-1000 votes.

details.title: TRENDS:
details.content:
Official ECI trends: Congress leading on 112 seats, BJP leading on 108 seats, BSP on 4 in Madhya Pradesh. #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/oQTv1g0HFW

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: TRENDS: Congress inches closer to halfway mark
details.content: Congress is currently leading in 115 seats while BJP is leading in 105. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and leader of the Opposition Ajay Singh both are leading in their respective constituencies.

details.title: BJP claims victory in one seat
details.content: The Bhartiya Janata Party has won one seat in Madhya Pradesh as counting nears the final phase.

details.title: BJP claims victory in one seat
details.content: The Bhartiya Janata Party has won one seat in Madhya Pradesh as counting nears the final phase.

details.title: Five more rounds of counting left, Congress crosses halfway mark
details.content: Only five more rounds of counting are left to decide which party's fate will be sealed today in the state. As of 5 pm, Congress is inching closer to victory with 118 seats.

details.title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee calls BJP's defeat 'the beginning of the end'
details.content: This is the semi-final of the final match as 2019 elections will be held in next 2-3 months. For 2019 final match game is clear, now we are just waiting for the elections.The countdown for 2019 has begun.This is the beginning of the end, says West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee

details.title: It's neck to neck between Congress and BJP
Aakash Kailash Vijayvargiya claims victory
details.content: BJP's Aakash Kailash Vijayvargiya wins from Indore-3 constituency with a margin of 7000 votes.

details.title: CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan leading from Budhni with over one lakh votes
BJP's Krishna Gaur leading in Govindpura with over 50,000 votes
details.content: Krishna Gaur, daughter of former CM Babulal Gaur is currently leading from Govindpura.

details.title: Nine victories for BJP so far
details.content: The Election Commission has declared nine victories for BJP and two for Congress.

details.title: As Congress inches closer to victory, BJP headquarters wear a deserted look
details.content: (Photo|PTI)

details.title: Digvijay Singh, Kamal Nath tasked with arranging numbers for reaching majority mark
details.content: Congress mobilises senior leaders Kamal Nath and Digvijay Singh to arrange the numbers to touch the majority mark for staking claim to form the new government. In this neck-to-neck fight, SP has already extended their support to Congress and BSP is likely to back the Opposition as well.

details.title: TRENDS SO FAR:
Rahul Gandhi addresses media after Congress' victory in Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh
details.content: I'd like to thank everyone who supported the Congress party, I'd also like to congratulate the parties which defeated us in Telangana and Mizoram. It's the victory of the traders, farmers and the youth. It's now the time for change.

details.title: Narendra Modi failed to deliver on his promises: Rahul Gandhi
details.content: We are going to provide these states a vision. We are going to provide these states a govt that they can be proud of. It is clear that there is a feeling among the people of this country that Narendra Modi has not been able to deliver on his promises:  Congress president Rahul Gandhi

details.title: Congress, BSP, SP have same ideology, to form government in MP: Asserts Rahul Gandhi
details.content: The ideology of SP, BSP & Congress is the same - different from that of BJP. There will not be a big issue of Chief Minister face. It will be done smoothly, says Rahul Gandhi.

details.title: Congress leaders AK Antony , Mallikarjun Kharge appointed as observers for Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh, respectively
Congress workers celebrate as party edges closer to victory
details.content:
Madhya Pradesh: Celebrations underway outside Congress office in Bhopal. Congress has won 12 seats leading on 100 seats in the state. #AssemblyElectionResults2018 pic.twitter.com/SvKfj1d8rl

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: BJP's Yashodhara Raje Scindia wins from Shivpuri
details.content: Sports Minister Yashodhara Raje Scindia wins from Shivpuri with a margin of 28,748 vote.

details.title: We accept the people’s mandate with humility, says Modi
details.content:
We accept the people’s mandate with humility.

I thank the people of Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan for giving us the opportunity to serve these states. The BJP Governments in these states worked tirelessly for the welfare of the people.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) December 11, 2018

details.title: Chouhan wins in Budhni constituency
details.content:
Shivraj Singh Chouhan wins Budhni constituency with a margin of 58,999 votes. #MadhyaPradeshElections pic.twitter.com/kTENV08Mvj

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: CM Chouhan retains his seat in Budhni
details.content: Shivraj Singh Chouhan wins Budhni constituency with a margin of 58,999 votes.

Madhya Pradesh: Congress party will go to the Governor House as soon as they win 116 seats in the state. The party has won 69 seats and is leading on 44 seats so far. #MadhyaPradeshElections pic.twitter.com/YvwrnTGFZQ

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Current status
Congress seeks Governor's appointment
details.content: Congress party seeks an appointment late tonight with the Governor to stake their claims to form the government in Madhya Pradesh. The party has sought appointment by sending an email and a fax too.

Governor House: An appointment will be given only after the situation is made clear by the Election Commission. #MadhyaPradeshElections2018 https://t.co/HSpUhYOcov

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018
An appointment will be given only after the situation is made clear by the Election Commission: Governor House
An appointment will be given only after the situation is made clear by the Election Commission: Governor House

No wonder the BJP is so upset today. The voters just gave them a triple talaaq.

— Shashi Tharoor (@ShashiTharoor) December 11, 2018

details.title: BJP expresses confidence
details.content: BJP Madhya Pradesh state unit chief Rakesh Singh told media that that his party is in touch with victorious independent candidates and will meet Governor on Wednesday.

details.title: Kamal Nath meets media
details.content: Declaring simple majority, Kamal Nath said the election verdict is victory of the people of Madhya Pradesh.

details.title: Kamal Nath writes to Governor
details.content: The mandate is the victory of women, farmers and youth, the Congressman added.
